snippet: In “Five Came Back,” Mark Harris, an Entertainment Weekly columnist, examines the wartime lives and work of John Huston, Frank Capra, John Ford, George Stevens and William Wyler.
abstract: Thomas Doherty reviews book Five Came Back: A Story of Hollywood and the Second World War by Mark Harris.
lead_paragraph: In “Five Came Back,” Mark Harris, an Entertainment Weekly columnist, examines the wartime lives and work of John Huston, Frank Capra, John Ford, George Stevens and William Wyler.

headline.seo: Mark Harris’s ‘Five Came Back’ Covers Auteurs in Combat
headline.main: Cameras Shooting in Battle: Five Auteurs and Their World War II Films
headline.print_headline: Cameras Shooting in Battle: Five Auteurs and Their World War II Films
